text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sarajevo press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The director of the Bosnian Employment Buerau condemns the federal government and the welfare minister for totally ignoring the present employment catastrophe in the country.

- United States government donates $5 million for the Initiative of Bosnian Women programme planed to be held under supervision of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), a U.N. spokesman said. The plan includes employment, social and medical care for Bosnian women.

- 125 kilometers-long access road to the eastern Bosnian enclave of Gorazde was opened on Monday, a spokesman for NATO- led implementation forces (IFOR) said. The road that connects Gorazde with Bosnian capital of Sarajevo have been built by IFOR engineers.
